players.name: Alice
memory: You're Alice, the villager.
Day 1 begins.

players.name: Bob
memory: You're Bob, the detective.
Night 1 begins.
The villager Alice was found dead.
You investigated Charlie and discovered that they are the mafioso.
Beware, Charlie knows you're the detective.
Day 1 begins.
You: "Charlie is the mafioso. I investigated him last night. Please vote Charlie. Diana, if I die tonight, remember this."
Diana: "Bob, if you’re the detective, why claim now with only one mafia? Charlie, what’s your response? Any alibi or thoughts on Bob’s claim? We should hear from both before voting."

Charlie: "Bob is either gambiting or lying; with 1 mafia, a real detective wouldn’t hard-claim D1 risking a mislynch tomorrow. Diana, look at incentives: if I were mafia, I’d push a counter-wagon—I'm not. Let’s hear Bob’s full night logic."

Charlie: "Bob’s claim doesn’t add up: with 1 mafia, a real detective waits to avoid being night-killed. He tunneled instantly without probing anyone else. Diana, let’s no-elim today and force more info."

Diana: "Charlie, proposing no-elim with 4 alive and 1 mafia helps mafia: we’d go to 3 with no extra info. Bob, confirm your target/order and why Alice died. Charlie, where would you vote if not no-elim?"

You: "Charlie is the mafioso. I investigated him N1. Mafia killed Alice to frame doubt. With 1 mafia, outing now lets town win today. Diana, don’t overthink: vote Charlie. If I were lying, mafia’d quick-push me."
Votes: Bob voted for Charlie, Charlie voted for Diana, Diana voted for Charlie
Charlie was arrested
